com.thekeirs.games.engine

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thekeirs.games.engine.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Sprite

    public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object

    Abstract superclass to represent a game object in the game world

    This class is abstract so it is never used directly to create instances. The Sprite class is a subclass that also manages an image and is thus usable in a game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      android.graphics.RectF boundingRect
      Tracks the upper left and lower right coordinates of a box that surrounds this object in world coordinates.
      protected GameObjectManager manager
      To be useful, every game object must register with the game object manager
      java.lang.String name
      The game object's name, used to look up an object in the game manager, or determine which object something has collided with.

    • Field Detail

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        The game object's name, used to look up an object in the game manager, or determine which object something has collided with.

      • boundingRect

        public android.graphics.RectF boundingRect
        Tracks the upper left and lower right coordinates of a box that surrounds this object in world coordinates.

      • manager

        protected GameObjectManager manager
        To be useful, every game object must register with the game object manager

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameObject

        public GameObject(java.lang.String name,
                  android.graphics.RectF extent)
        Basic constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - name of this sprite (used to look it up later)
        extent - initial area on the screen this sprite will occupy, in world units

    • Method Detail

      • setManager

        public void setManager(GameObjectManager manager)
        Called by the GameObjectManager to be sure this game object knows who its manager is. This method is called automatically - do not use.
        Parameters:
        manager - the current game object manager

      • update

        public void update(int msec)
        Called once per screen refresh by the GameObjectManager to update the size, location, or other attributes of this game object as needed by the game's logic.

        If you are creating a subclass of GameObject or Sprite be sure to call super.update() in your update() method so that the object removal logic will work correctly.

        Parameters:
        msec - number of millseconds since the previous update call. Typically 16msec at 60Hz screen refresh.

      • onTouch

        public void onTouch(float x,
                    float y)
        Called when the user taps the screen at a location inside this game object's bounding box.
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal coordinate in world units
        y - vertical coordinate in world units

      • onFling

        public void onFling(float x,
                    float y,
                    float dx,
                    float dy)
        Called when the user makes a fling motion on the screen, starting at a location inside this game object's bounding box.
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal coordinate in world units
        y - vertical coordinate in world units

      • setMaxTimeOnScreen

        public void setMaxTimeOnScreen(int msec)
        Configure this game object to self-destruct after a given number of milliseconds on the screen.

        When the game engine properly supports pausing/unpausing the game, this count should also "freeze" in place and resume counting again automatically.

        Parameters:
        msec - number of milliseconds until this game object requests automatic removal

      • getTimeOnScreen

        public long getTimeOnScreen()
        Check how long a game object has been alive.
        Returns:
        number of milliseconds this game object has been on screen/managed by the manager.

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(android.graphics.Canvas c,
                          float xScale,
                          float yScale)
        Must be implemented by any subclasses to do the work of actually drawing the game object onto the screen.
        Parameters:
        c - the Canvas object the game is currently being drawn onto
        xScale - the horizontal scaling factor between world coordinates and screen coordinates
        yScale - the vertical scaling factor between world coordinates and screen coordinates

      • contains

        public boolean contains(float x,
                        float y)
        Checks if this game object's bounding box includes a given point.
        Parameters:
        x - horizontal coordinate of the point to check, in world units
        y - vertical coofdinate of the point to check, in world units
        Returns:
        true if the point is inside this object's bounding box

      • hop

        public void hop(float distance,
                float direction)
        Instantaneously move the game object a given distance in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        distance - distance to hop, in world units
        direction - direction to hop in degrees counter-clockwise from the X axis

      • moveBy

        public void moveBy(float dx,
                   float dy)
        Adjust the game object's position by a given dx and dy offset
        Parameters:
        dx - horizontal offset in world coordinates
        dy - vertical offset in world coordinates

      • hopToward

        public void hopToward(float distance,
                      float destx,
                      float desty)
        Instantaneously hop the sprite a given distance in the direction of another point in world space.

        For instance, if you want bullets from a flying saucer to always fly towards your player's ship, this routine might be helpful.

        Parameters:
        distance - distance in world units to move the game object
        destx - horizontal coordinate of the point to move towards
        desty - vertical coordinate of the point to move towards

      • isInside

        public final boolean isInside(GameObject other)
        Checks if this game object's bounding rectangle is entirely inside of another object.
        Parameters:
        other - the game object to test if this object is inside of.
        Returns:
        true if this object is entirely inside other

      • intersects

        public final boolean intersects(GameObject other)
        Checks if this game object's bounding area intersects at all with another game object.
        Parameters:
        other - the game object to test if this object is touching
        Returns:
        true if this object intersects/touches other

      • isFullyOnScreen

        public boolean isFullyOnScreen()
        Returns true if this game object is entirely within the boundaries of the screen at the object's current location.
        Returns:
        true if the object is entirely on-screen

      • isFullyOffScreen

        public boolean isFullyOffScreen()
        Returns true if this object is entirely outside the boundaries of the screen at the object's current location.
        Returns:
        true if the object is entirely off-screen

      • requestRemoval

        public final void requestRemoval()
        Request that the game object manager remove this sprite after this update loop is complete.

      • removalRequested

        public final boolean removalRequested()
        Check if this game object is scheduled for removal
        Returns:
        true if this object will be removed.
